Physician

You learned how to treat wounds and cure ailments. You could have been an apothecary, herbalist, surgeon, midwife, or even a veterinary. You could have learned and practiced your medicine in any one of a number of settings, be it university, house calls, or even the battlefield.

Ability Score Increase. Your Wisdom, Intelligence, or Dexterity score increases by 1. Your Wisdom, Intelligence, or Constitution score increases by 1.

Field Triage. Whenever you stabilize a creature, it returns to consciousness with 1 hit point after 1d4 rounds instead of hours. @Compendium[5e-stat-decoupled.abilities.5Z2HIH8V4D9ZKOGW]{Field Triage}

Routine Checkup. You can treat a healer’s kit as having twice the number of uses. In addition, you can tend to the wounds of one creature over the course of a short rest. For each hit die the creature expends, you can expend one use of your healer’s kit to cause them to treat the die as its maximum value instead of rolling. @Compendium[5e-stat-decoupled.abilities.ZK08MXNFZWTOYWT7]{Routine Checkup}

Skills. Choose one from: Animal Handling, Medicine, Nature, Persuasion, Sleight of Hand.

Tools. You gain proficiency with the Herbalism kit or Poisoner’s kit.

Language. One of your choice.
